column2: Positive for translocation or inversion events involving the ALK gene locus (e.g. resulting in EML4-ALK fusion) as defined by a Clinical Laboratory Improvement Act (CLIA)-approved test
ALK rearrangement identified by next generation (NextGen) sequencing

Patients must have completed any prior adjuvant chemotherapy or radiation therapy 2 or more weeks (6 or more weeks for mitomycin and nitrosoureas) prior to randomization and be adequately recovered at the time of randomization
column7: (completed adjuvant chemotherapy or radiation therapy ≥ 2 weeks prior to randomization) ∧ (adequately recovered at time of randomization)

column2: Prior to randomization patients with any non-hematologic toxicity from surgery, chemotherapy, or radiation must have recovered to grade =< 1 with the exception of alopecia and the criteria outlined
column7: Criterion Text = "Prior to randomization patients with any non-hematologic toxicity from surgery, chemotherapy, or radiation must have recovered to grade =< 1 with the exception of alopecia and the criteria outlined"

column2: No known interstitial fibrosis or interstitial lung disease
No prior treatment with crizotinib or another ALK inhibitor
column7: Not(Prior Therapy contains Crizotinib or another ALK inhibitor)

column2: Patients must not have any history of locally advanced or metastatic cancer requiring systemic therapy within 5 years from randomization, with the exception of in-situ carcinomas and non-melanoma skin cancer
column6: History of locally advanced or metastatic cancer

column2: Patients must have no previous primary lung cancer diagnosed concurrently or within the past 2 years
